result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Driving Wrong Way on Divided Highway

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anjali Sharma

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defense requests an adjournment. State does not object. Case is adjourned, parties notified. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defense's Adjournment Request to the Court, received and filed.
Order; Attorney Emma L. Guthrie is withdrawn as an attorney of record.  Signed and Filed.  nk

Attorney John Birdsall in court.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's appearance waived for purposes of scheduling.  Due to a conflict in attorney Birdsall's calendar, Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 25.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anjali Sharma in court with attorney Emma Guthrie.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Patrick J Anderson appeared by video means. Parties are requesting additional time for continued negotiations. Case is adjourned in Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anjali Sharma in court with Attorney John A Birdsall.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the Milwaukee, County of.  All parties appear in person.
Defendant has four cases before the court.

Arraignment held.
Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. 

Defense counsel advises Court there may be a deferred prosecution resolution as to this case.
Court orders this case adjourned for hearing in Branch 28.

Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective June 13, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.
Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.

Clerk:  jms

Court ordered the $1000.00 cash bail to be returned to the remitter.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.  Court ordered case adjourned for Arraignment in Branch 28.

Defendant Anjali Sharma in court with attorney John A Birdsall.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Arraignment scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
